data.title: GG19 - Climate Solutions
data.description: We are participating in Gitcoin Round 19 (GG19).

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

The CCN Climate Solutions Round's mission to accelerate blockchain-enabled climate solutions on a global scale, catalyzing diverse forms of climate action in order to create a sustainable and equitable future for all. Through strategic grant distribution coupled with support, we empower climate projects that are dedicated to reducing greenhouse gas emissions and serving as essential core infrastructure for web3 climate solutions.
data.title: CCN Climate Solutions Rounds

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

Our project was selected to be part of the [GG20 Celo Public Goods Climate Bonus Round](https://mirror.xyz/celopg.eth/McicejfzasLM0nD5HKNdPukgQHvVrRVT2GiFwwzf8AA).


### **Celo Claim:**

Your project has organised events and meetups that support the Celo ecosystem., Your project has produced research, media or other resources that support the Celo ecosystem.

We launched the Regens Unite Berlin second annual event with a Celo Education Zone in September 2023. The Education Zone served as a dedicated space during the event for attendees to learn more about Celo, going through onboarding, and meet members of the community.

- 200 attendees at Regens Unite Berlin 2023

- Celo Education Zone: https://x.com/regensunite/status/1710298471930974498

- Recap thread: https://twitter.com/regensunite/status/1710298452301590902

On March 27th we gathered over 30 people in a 2-hour interactive call to map out projects and experiments that contribute to regenerating our economies. The call was initiated by the Citizen Wallet, and facilitated by the facilitators of Regens Unite. The goal of the project was to bring more visibilities to the wide variety of projects out there, and to help people find out how they can contribute and join. The full report is linked and a follow up call is planned May 27th.

- Full report of call: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1FpZxehzQDrcV0_7Myv2QLy8JJtW3OzQ0sfkmXfO0VQE/edit#heading=h.csp2wgnshcpn

Recently at our event in Amsterdam in April 2024, we experimented with the Regen Hour Token on Celo network.

- Tweet: https://twitter.com/regensunite/status/1781307165531107419

questions.query: Impact statement - what real world problem do you solve and how
questions.explanation:
The climate crisis requires diverse expertise and innovative solutions, but there are many gaps between different sectors working on regenerative climate solutions. 

Regens Unite is successfully bridging these gaps by: 

 Regens Unite bridges these gaps by:

- Organizing curated, facilitated events that connect experts from various fields with web3 innovators.

- Producing educational media to share knowledge and inspire action.

- Building a platform to connect regenerative projects with resources and each other.

- Bringing non-web3 expertise into the space to broaden the regenerative movement.

- Providing rapid feedback opportunities for innovative web3 projects.

- Driving inclusivity and diversity in web3 through curated attendance and scholarships.

questions.query: Celo leverage - how does your project contributed to the Celo ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Regens Unite has supported Celo Europe and Celo Foundation by building on the CELO ecosystem and through representation in physical and online events over the past year.

- Celo brand represented at Regen Village - July 2024

- Regen Hour Token on Celo network implemented during "Honor the Earth Festival" 2024

- Regenerative Economics Community Call - March 27th

- Celo Education Zone at Regens Unite Berlin 2023

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoinâ€™s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

questions.query: If you've participated in past grant rounds, please share any new updates or milestones from the prior months (N/A if you are yet to participate).
questions.explanation: Since last round, we have:   1) Kickstarted the organisation of "[New to Web3? Start Here](https://lu.ma/k5kc8iij)â€, an onboarding-focused event for the local Thai community during Devcon SEA. Cori and Guil are organizing this in collaboration with Ornella from Bankless Academy and Caolan.  2) Proposed a [Regen Community Hub](https://forum.devcon.org/t/sea-community-hub-proposal-regen-hub) during Devcon SEA to connect local and regional builders with global attendees. Proposal is currently in voting stage. https://x.com/regensunite/status/1829535010317312134

questions.query: Have you participated in any Octant epoch (Epoch 0 through Epoch 4) OR a previous Gitcoin Grants round? Please provide details and evidence of your participation.
questions.explanation: Yes, we have participated in the last Gitcoin Grants Round (GG21), [link here](https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/projects/0x662b4534f8c40a04469ac8ac3fc4728c4a450e5166aa7c22a28a3b54cc27e830)

questions.query: Please describe how your project contributes to the growth and development of the Octant ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Our community consists of environmentalists, activists, technologists, impact investors, DAOists, and builders who care about evolving and funding public goods. Through our participation in Epoch 5, we are amplifying Octantâ€™s mission to fund public goods and bring new projects and community members into the ecosystem.

questions.query: How does your project align with the round's focus on community and education within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation: Community-building and education are core pillars of Regens Uniteâ€™s work. The programming in our in-person and digital events is curated to cross-pollinate knowledge around new funding mechanisms, tooling, resources and learnings, and bridge diverse communities who care about regeneration and public goods. Our media channels (YouTube, Paragraph newsletter) share free educational content for public learning.

questions.query: Provide a clear roadmap of your project, detailing future milestones and deliverables. How does this demonstrate your commitment to long-term impact and growth within the Octant ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
We aim to raise funds to build the next initiatives for the Regens Unite community and support our organising, communications, programming, and facilitation work.
****

Q3 2024

- **Event Planning (IRL + Digital)**: Organize the â€œNew to Web3? Start Hereâ€ onboarding event and Regen Hub community hub at Devcon 2024 (Bangkok), as well as ongoing digital webinars on regenerative topics.
- **Content Creation**: Produce and share recorded webinars, project interviews, and event highlights from the Regen Village, featuring Octant as a partner.
- **Launch a community spotlight page:** to feature supporters and partnerships (including Octant), amplify community projects and hubs, and connect community members.
- **Ongoing Support of Commons Hub Brussels**: Our flagship physical regen hub launched during EthCC Brussels.

Q4 2024

- **Event Production**: Produce and host two events at Devcon 2024 (Bangkok)
- **Partnership Building**: Form media partnerships and alliances within the web3 space to collaborate on global events and amplify our storytelling.

Q1 2025

- **Event Planning for next destinations**: ETH Denver, Brussels, Cape Town, Costa Rica, ETH Berlin
- Enhance initiatives based on feedback, and continue expanding our community and impact in the regenerative movement.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise and how it contributes to the successful execution of your project.
questions.explanation:
Cori Schlicht - founding member, managing partnerships, fundraising and communications. 15 year background in commercial sales, customer success and digital communications. Helping DAOs and public goods grow since 2022.

Leen Shelfhout - founding member, managing community engagement and Brussels initiatives. 20-year professional background in facilitation and participatory program design.

Guil Maueler - founding member, managing creative direction and storytelling. 15-year professional background in the creative industry, creator of The DAOist brand, and working for the past 3 years helping DAOs to drive impact through powerful branding.

Xavier Damman - founding member, managing technical integrations and programs through Citizen Wallet as well as organizing events in Brussels. 20-year background in tech entrepreneurship, from Silicon Valley to web3.

questions.query: How does your project complement or enhance existing initiatives within the Octant ecosystem rather than competing directly against them?
questions.explanation: Our mission is to unite regens and catalyse positive impact by connecting projects with one another. Our programs are designed to help initiatives discuss ways to stack tooling and discover opportunities for collaboration - because collaboration over competition is what regeneration is about. If we succeed in this mission, everyone benefits.

questions.query: Describe your approach to community engagement and how you plan to contribute to a collaborative and constructive funding environment.
questions.explanation: We elevate regen voices through IRL and online events, by providing interactive platforms and participatory programs that encourage healthy debate and active discussion. Our most recent event, the Regen Village, included a 2-day program about the evolution of web3 grants funding as well as another day about on-chain capital allocation where the community had a space to share constructive feedback and ideas.

questions.query: How do you plan to use the funding to maximize your project's ongoing impact within the Octant ecosystem if selected?
questions.explanation: The funding will be used to compensate our core team for implementing the outlined roadmap, paying for the maintenance of our digital infrastructure (website, collaboration tools, tech stack), and covering costs associated with organising events.

questions.query: What unique educational content or resources have you created for the Octant ecosystem? How has the community received these? Please share any relevant links
questions.explanation:
We created a sizzle after-movie of the Regen Village, which represents Octant as a partner through logo placement. This was shared on our X account which received a lot of positive feedback. Link â†’ https://x.com/regensunite/status/1813920871091999144

On our [Regens Unite Youtube Channel](https://www.notion.so/Community-Page-8c7d4e47331949478ddb3b25e021ec07?pvs=21), we also published recorded sessions in which Octant was represented:

- [Grant Allocation Strategy (Panel) @ Regen Village EthCC Brussels 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rt-5oRFborQ&ab_channel=RegensUnite)
- [How to Sustainably Grow the Community (Panel) @ Regen Village EthCC Brussels 2024](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E8g-qDOY_T4&ab_channel=RegensUnite)

*(All sessions recorded and published at Regen Village contain Octant's logo)*

data.name: Octant
data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

The purpose of this grant is for Regens Unite to foster community engagement, education, and onboarding in the web3 space through targeted initiatives. The grant will support the launch of a community spotlight page to showcase impactful projects and services, produce a documentary film highlighting the positive societal impact of web3 initiatives while addressing misconceptions about the "Regen" narrative, and organize an onboarding-focused event in Bangkok as well as a community hub within Devcon in collaboration with local and international partners. These efforts aim to strengthen the regenerative movement and it's connection with the web3 space, bridge local and global builders, and empower communities through emerging technologies.
data.title: Octant - Epoch 5

milestones.title: Community platform launch
milestones.description: We plan to launch a community spotlight page used to showcase projects, testimonials from key community members, and community service/product offerings.

milestones.title: Educational Content: Regen Movie
milestones.description: We plan to produce a new movie that recaps our latest initiative in Brussels where we demonstrated how web3 event spend can leave positive impact on local communities - in this example, we launched a permanent coworking space. The film will also address the current problematic perception around the meme â€œRegen.â€

milestones.title: Onboarding Event & Regen Hub in Bangkok
milestones.description:
The feedback from EthCC is that there was no onboarding-focused events. We are planning an event in Bangkok focused on web3 onboarding with the local Thai community, in collaboration with Bankless Academy, Harpie, Moo Team, and others.

We have also proposed to run a Regen Hub as a community hub within Devcon.

data.title: Community Platform Development
data.description: Further development of our community page to include published video interviews/testimonials, after movies, and project showcases.

data.title: Onboarding Resources for Event Organizers
data.description: We are continuously fielding requests, both within our in-person events and through online inbound calls, from organizers around the world who are interested to organize a Regens Unite event in their region or launch a local chapter. To enable this form of decentralized community growth, we need an accessible onboarding flow with supportive assets.

data.title: Regen Hub at Devcon 7 SEA
data.description:
Produce a 4-day event as a dedicated community-hub within Devcon 7 SEA, which included sourcing a daily program of presentations and activities in a curated space.

The Regen Hub is a dedicated space focused on promoting local projects and initiatives, fostering discussions around regenerative work in web3, and connecting newcomers with educational resources and communities in the web3 space.

The hub will be a vibrant, community-driven space that aims to represent the Thai and Southeast Asian web3 community and offer a facilitated program to build bridges with global Ethereum builders.

Approved proposal: https://forum.devcon.org/t/sea-community-hub-proposal-regen-hub/3946

data.reason:

data.title: Regen Coordination Global
data.description: The GG23 Regen Coordination Global round is an innovative impact-driven funding round designed to support regenerative finance (ReFi) networks that have demonstrated meaningful contributions to the ecosystem. Following on from the GG21 Genesis Round, this round brings together ReFi DAO, GreenPill Network, and other Regen Coordination partner networks to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs.

data.title: Organize dApps event in Berlin Blockchain Week
data.description:
Organize and produce an event in June that brings together builders in ReFi, regen Web3, and AI to enhance coordination around solution designs and share learnings on latest developments. 

The goal is to provide a platform for projects that are approaching AI with a regenerative mindset, and facilitate opportunities for collaboration with ReFi and regenerative web3 projects.

data.title: Build out Community Page
data.description:
The current community page promotes ReFi and climate-focused communities in Web3 - serving as a portal of discovery for newcomers to the Web3 regen space.

The next iteration will be updated to:

- showcase impactful ReFi projects and tooling
- include supportive communities and networks in the Ethereum ecosystem and beyond
- point to onboarding resources and partners
- highlight key builders and thought leaders

https://www.regensunite.earth/community

data.title: Design framework for decentralized brand use
data.description:
We plan on supporting global organizers to host their own events, either branded as Regens Unite or in partnership with the brand, thereby fund local spaces around the world.

This priority arises in response to consistent inbound requests from organizers who want to host onboarding events, community gatherings, and retreats that enable people to exchange learnings and collaborate on ReFi, web3 onboarding, climate tech, activism, art and music. 

Establishing an extended network of events allows us to easily partner and contribute to many events at once, building more awareness of the Web3 regen space, ReFi tooling, funding opportunities like QF, and in exchange gather insights from around the world. This framework is the first milestone.

data.text:
Through sponsorships raised for our Regen Village event in July 2024, we generated 25,000 EUR to fund a new innovation hub for local regenerative projects and web3 builders in Brussels interested in ReFi, collaboration technology, and climate action.

Launched shortly after the event as the Commons Hub Brussels, this permanent community space continues to serve as a gathering ground for regular events and coworking in the Ethereum ecosystem and beyond. It runs experiments with community currencies, hosts meetups, and serves as breeding ground for regenerative action.

Financial reporting from Commons Hub Brussels: https://x.com/commonshub_bxl/status/1830317788667216204
data.title: Funded local community hub: Commons Hub Brussels

data.text:
Regens Unite producedÂ the Regen Village in July 2024,Â transforming a stunning venue in Brussels into a weeklong regenerative basecamp for innovators and changemakers. Running alongside EthCC From July 8th to 12th, this dynamic experience included co-working, panels, workshops, and community experiments, fostering deeper connections and showcasing crypto and frontier tech as tools for regeneration. 

This event showcased many public goods builders and funders in ReFi and the greater Ethereum ecosystem, including Celo, Octant, Giveth, Glo Dollar, Regen Tips, EthicHub, and more. The event promoted onboarding and awareness of this space to newcomers, including an onboarding booth with Bankless Academy, and also encouraged further development of the ReFi space with founder/investor matchmaking, interactive panels and workshops.

The event also generated significant local community impact by funneling $25k of event spend to kickstart a new innovation hub, and accelerating the setup of the space with furniture and equipment. 

The local Brussels news channels reported on the event, interviewing the organizers and bringing additional awareness to the Ethereum community.

- 5-day event
- 600+ attendees
- 7823 $RegenBxl issued in partnership with Citizen Wallet
- â‚¬25k in funding provided to kickstart the Commons Hub Brussels
data.title: Regen Village event at EthCC

data.text:
Regens Unite was honored to be an organizational partner in the first edition of New to Web3? Start Here, a practical, Ethereum-focused, blockchain onboarding experience for the local Thai community in Bangkok. 

This one-day event included panels, games, a wallet setup workshop, and a garden of booths for attendees to learn how to complete their first transaction, mint an NFT, learn about regenerative communities in Web3, DAOs, and more. Other organizational partners Bankless Academy, and Coalan from ETHDublin. Sponsored by Harpie, and supported by an extended partner network.

We were the only onboarding event offered in Thai language out of 600+ side events.

- 80+ local Bangkok students and mentors participated

We verified over 200 onchain actions:

- 47 new wallets connected to our event app
- 50 POAPs and NFTs minted (18 minted their first NFT ever)
- 35 participants claimed ETH & USDC on Base
- 25 completed their first onchain swap

1 after-movie produced with recap: https://www.instagram.com/reel/DHKBb4_TrIk/
data.title: "New to Web3? Start Here" onboarding event

data.text:
At the lastÂ Devcon 7 SEA in Thailand, Regens Unite hosted theÂ Regen Hub, a 4-day community-driven experience connecting Southeast Asian changemakers with the global Web3 community. The goal was to bring in regional projects (both within and outside of web3), showcase their work to visitors, and foster new connections as well as deeper discussions around key challenges in local communities and the solutions being worked on.

500+ active participants

200+ regens recorded on map

30+ hours of programming hosted

25+ projects showcased

1 after-movie created
data.title: "Regen Hub" community hub at Devcon SEA 7
